newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CLOSING DEBT MARKET REPORT.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CLOSING DEBT MARKET REPORT.

text.p: Dutch bonds end just lower after slow session, taking cue from Bund futures which becalmed by speculation over Bundesbank rate outlook, dealers say.
Weaker dollar later helps market off early lows, but little trade while repo uncertainty rules.
Dutch central bank leaves special advances rate unchanged, little effect on Guilder market though currency weakness versus the mark had had some looking for an independent rate rise.
Curve steepening continues from Wednesday, though more subdued. Spreads to Germany remain mainly stable, very long end makes some ground.
Interest still in short and medium end of the yield curve, traders say, 8.25 pct February 2002 bond popular and area continuing to benefit from unwind of flattening trades of last months.
